description: From French incompétent, from Late Latin incompetentem, from Latin incompetēns.

adjectives.description: incompetent (comparative more incompetent, superlative most incompetent)

entries.meaning: Unskilled; lacking the degree of ability that would normally be expected.
examples: Having an incompetent lawyer may be grounds for a retrial, but the lawyer in question probably doesn't know that.

entries.meaning: Unable to make rational decisions; insane or otherwise cognitively impaired.
examples: The charged was judged incompetent to stand trial, at least until his medication started working.

entries.meaning: (medicine, of the cervix) Opening too early during pregnancy, resulting in miscarriage or premature birth.
(geology) Not resistant to deformation or flow.
